field_label:
RAS ID: 304278 
 
Participant Identification Number for this study:  

CONSENT FORM  

Title of project: ADHD Remote Technology study of cardiometabolic risk factors and medication adherence ('ART-CARMA') 

Name of researcher:  

Thank you for reading the information leaflet about this research study. If you would like to take part, please read on and sign this form. You also need to initial the boxes below for each statement you agree with.

I confirm that I have read the information sheet dated XX.XX.XXXX (version XX.XX) for the above study. I have had the opportunity to consider the information, ask questions and have had these answered satisfactorily, and I understand why the research is being done and any risks involved.
I understand that my participation is voluntary and that I am free to withdraw at any time without giving any reason, and without my medical care or legal rights being affected.
I understand that my involvement in the research study does not affect my usual care.

I understand that relevant sections of my medical records and data collected during the study may be looked at by individuals from King's College London and my clinical care team from the ADHD clinic, where it is relevant to my taking part in this research. I give permission for these individuals to access to my records.

I agree to my pseudonymised data being entered into a study database. I understand how the information will be collected and stored for up to 10 years and that my personal data will not be shared with anyone outside the research team or my clinical team.
I understand that the information collected about me will be used to support other research in the future, and may be shared anonymously with other researchers.

I understand that the systems used to remotely collect my data are purely intended for research purposes and not intended to affect my normal care, and no guarantees are made that any clinical staff will be notified by the system of changes to my health status.

I understand that I will be invited to speak with a member of the research at the end of the 12-months to provide feedback on the study. These interviews will be audio-recorded but I can ask for the recording to be turned off at any point.

I agree to my pseudonymised data and quotes contributing to publications and other outputs. I understand that no publication or output from my participation will contain data or results that can be linked back to me as an individual.

I understand that the baseline assessments will either be administered virtually by a member of the research team using Microsoft Teams or in-person with a research worker at the SGDP Centre, Institute of Psychiatry, Psychology and Neuroscience.

I agree that information about me obtained during the study may be transmitted through a computer network, or through the internet or transferred via removable media. This information will be pseudonymised and will not include anything which could identify me by name, address or date of birth. I agree to allow this pseudonymised information to be analysed by people involved in this research project.

I understand that data from the EmbracePlus is also stored on the EmbracePlus database, and I have read and agree to the terms and conditions and privacy policy of the EmbracePlus company. I understand that the data stored on the EmbracePlus database will not include any information that could identify me by name, address, or date of birth. I understand that I can ask for my data to be deleted from the EmbracePlus database at the end of the study.
I agree that if an unexpected problem emerged during the assessments, the research team have a duty of care to report this to either my clinical care team (if still in contact) or my GP.
I know how to contact the research team if I need to, and how to get information about the results of the research.

(OPTIONAL) I give permission for King's College London to store my DNA saliva sample. I agree that my saliva sample will be shared with colleagues at Vall d'Hebron University Hospital (Barcelona) for analysis. I agree to have my data used in future research projects in an anonymised manner with other research groups.

(OPTIONAL) I agree I have read the 'stool collection information sheet dated 30.11.2021 (v1.1) and I give permission for my pseudonymous data to be transmitted and my pseudonymised stool samples to be sent to Radboud University Nijmegen (Netherlands) to study the gut microbiome.

(OPTIONAL) I agree for the research team to contact my GP to inform them about my involvement in the research study. I understand that the research team do not send the data collected from the study to my GP.
(OPTIONAL) I agree to be contacted in the future regarding follow up studies. The research team may request my participation in similar studies or other related medical research studies.
I agree to take part in the above study.

I give permission for King's College London to store my DNA saliva sample. I agree that my saliva sample will be shared with colleagues at Vall d'Hebron University Hospital (Barcelona) for analysis. I agree to have my data used in future research projects in an anonymised manner with other research groups.

I agree I have read the 'stool collection information sheet dated 30.11.2021 (v1.1) and I give permission for my pseudonymous data to be transmitted and my pseudonymised stool samples to be sent to Radboud University Nijmegen (Netherlands) to study the gut microbiome.
I agree for the research team to contact my GP to inform them about my involvement in the research study. I understand that the research team do not send the data collected from the study to my GP.
I agree to be contacted in the future regarding follow up studies. The research team may request my participation in similar studies or other related medical research studies.

field_label: 1. Do you use olive oil as main culinary fat?

How many vegetable servings do you consume per day? 
(1 serving : 200g [consider side dishes as half a serving])
4. How many fruit units (including natural fruit juices) do you consume per day?

5. How many servings of red meat, hamburger, or meat products (ham, sausage, etc.) do you consume per day?
(1 serving: 100-150g)

(1 serving: 12g)

8. How much wine do you drink per week? (in glasses)

(1 serving: 150g)

(1 serving 100-150g of fish or 4-5 units or 200g of shellfish)
11. How many times per week do you consume commercial sweets or pastries (not homemade), such as cakes, cookies, biscuits, or custard?

12. How many servings of nuts (including peanuts) do you consume per week?
(1 serving 30g)
13. Do you preferentially consume chicken, turkey, or rabbit meat instead of veal, pork, hamburger or sausage?
14. How many times per week do you consume vegetables, pasta, rice, or other dishes seasoned with sofrito (sauce made with tomato and onion, leek, or garlic and simmered with olive oil)?
Using the weighing scales the study provided, please tell us your weight

select_choices_or_calculations.label: Find the bottom of your ribs and the top of your hips.
Place a tape measure around your middle at a point halfway between them (just above the belly button).
Make sure it's pulled tight, but isn't digging into your skin.
Breathe out naturally and take your measurement.
Take your measurement again, just to be sure.
• Please sit quietly for 5 minutes, with your back supported and feet on the floor.
• Support the arm, so that the cuff will be at the same level as the heart (e.g. table).
• The cuff should be positioned 2-3cm over the elbow; the air tube should run down the inside of the forearm and should be in line with the middle finger.
• The cuff is suited for an arm circumference of 22-42cm.
• Make 2 repeated recordings (5 minutes between the 2 recordings) over the right arm.
• Report the values of the 2 recordings of systolic and diastolic measurements on this app.
• Note the heart rate at the second recording.
• For further instructions, please see your Technology User Guide or contact the research team.
